title: Automated Formative Assessment Design for Evaluating Non-Declarative Knowledge

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science knowledge and digital literacy
context.additional_context: Learners are assessed on non-declarative knowledge (experimental skills, problem-solving abilities, etc.) in mobile-based microlearning environments and receive comparative peer group data through automated feedback systems

learning_goals: Learners can quantitatively analyze their experimental skills and problem-solving processes through automated formative assessments.
Learners can diagnose and improve their tacit knowledge levels based on comparative data with peer groups.
Learners can adjust their learning strategies in real-time using a feedback system provided in mobile environments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
